org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.semantics

Class MethodBodySemanticChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.semantics.MethodBodySemanticChecker

  • public class MethodBodySemanticChecker
extends Object
    The MethodBodySemanticChecker contains the logic that checks method body semantics.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MethodBodySemanticChecker(LexicalScope current_scope)
      Construct a new MethodBodySemanticChecker from the current lexical scope.

        Semantic analysis of a function declared inside another function. This is only for function declarations, and not function expressions.
        Parameters:
        funcNode - The node of the nested function

        lvalue - - the resolved lvalue (which is also an implicit rvalue).

      • checkReference

        public void checkReference(Binding b)
        Check for possible problems with a reference for an r-value. This will find 2 kinds of problems: 1. Ambiguous references 2. References to deprecated symbols
        Parameters:
        b - the binding to check

      • checkReference

        public void checkReference(Binding b,
                  boolean forLValue)
        Check for possible problems with a reference. This will find 2 kinds of problems: 1. Ambiguous references 2. References to deprecated symbols
        Parameters:
        b - the binding to check
        forLValue - Whether the binding is for an l-value.

      • checkInitialValue

        public PooledValue checkInitialValue(IVariableNode iNode,
                            Binding type,
                            PooledValue initial_value)
        Check the initial value of an IVariableNode. The specified IVariableNode could be:
        • an IParameterNode for a function parameter.
        • an IVariableNode for a var or const in any scope.
        This method will create ICompilerProblems if the specified initial value is not the correct type and will return an initializer value that is the correct type that was created by apply the AS3 coercion rules.
        Parameters:
        iNode - The IVariableNode whose initializer value should be checked.
        type - A Binding for the specified IVariableNode's type annotation.
        initial_value - A PooledValue that contains the constant initializer value computed by the constant propagation code.
        Returns:
        A PooledValue with the correct type to initialize the specified IVariableNode. This can be the same as the specified PooledValue if it was already of the correct type.

        Check foo++ and foo-- expressions.
        Parameters:
        iNode - the inc/dec Node
        is_incr - whether this is an increment or decrement operation
        binding - the binding for the name we are incrementing/decrementing

      • addTypeProblem

        public void addTypeProblem(IASNode typeNode,
                  IDefinition typeDef,
                  String typeDesc,
                  boolean reportAmbiguousReference)
        Add the appropriate Problem when a type annotation did not resolve to a Type
        Parameters:
        typeNode - the Node to use for location info for the problem
        typeDef - The IDefinition the type annotation resolved to
        typeDesc - A String to use as the description of the type annotation in the diagnostic
        reportAmbiguousReference - A flag indicating whether an AmbiguousReferenceProblem should be reported, if the typeDef is ambiguous.

      • checkQualifier

        Check the qualifier of a qualified name ('a' in 'a::foo')
        Parameters:
        iNode - the node representing the qualifier

        public void checkRestParameter(IASNode iNode,
                      Binding param_type)
        Check a rest parameter declaration (...rest)
        Parameters:
        iNode - - the ParameterNode for the rest decl.
        param_type - - the type of the rest param

      • checkFunctionForConflictingDefinitions

        public boolean checkFunctionForConflictingDefinitions(IASNode iNode,
                                             FunctionDefinition funcDef)
        Check for other definitions that might conflict with the function passed in. This method will issue a diagnostic if there are any definitions with the same name in the same declaring scope. It will not find conflicts in base classes - if a method conflicts in something in a base class some sort of illegal override error will already have been issued.
        Parameters:
        iNode - The Node that produced the function definition. Used for location info for any diagnostics.
        funcDef - The FunctionDefinition of the function to check

      • checkInterfaceFunctionForConflictingDefinitions

        public void checkInterfaceFunctionForConflictingDefinitions(IASNode iNode,
                                                   FunctionDefinition funcDef)
        Check for other definitions that might conflict with the function passed in. This method is for interface functions, so it will check for dups in the current interface, and also look for any conflicts in base interfaces.
        Parameters:
        iNode - The node that produced the function definition. Used for location info for any diagnostics.
        funcDef - The FunctionDefinition of the interface function to check

      • checkVariableForConflictingDefinitions

        public void checkVariableForConflictingDefinitions(IASNode iNode,
                                          VariableDefinition varDef)
        Check for other definitions that might conflict with the variable passed in. This method will check for conflicts in the declaring scope of the variable, and if it is declared in a class it will check for conflicts in the base classes.
        Parameters:
        iNode - The node that produced the variable definition. Used for location info for any diagnostics.
        varDef - The VariableDefinition of the variable to check

      • enterConstructor

        public void enterConstructor()
        Signal the semantic checker that its caller is entering a constructor: initialize constructor-specific state variables.

      • leaveConstructor

        public void leaveConstructor()
        Signal the semantic checker that its caller is leaving a constructor: reset constructor-specific state variables.

      • canGetterBeInlined

        public boolean canGetterBeInlined(AccessorDefinition accessor)
        Test whether the getter for the specified accessor can be inlined
        Parameters:
        accessor - The accessor to test whether the getter can be inlined
        Returns:
        true if the getter can be inlined

      • canSetterBeInlined

        public boolean canSetterBeInlined(AccessorDefinition accessor)
        Test whether the setter for the specified accessor can be inlined
        Parameters:
        accessor - The accessor to test whether the setter can be inlined
        Returns:
        true if the setter can be inlined

      • canFunctionBeInlined

        public boolean canFunctionBeInlined(FunctionDefinition function)
        Test whether the specified function can be inlined. If the function can't be inlined, a problem will be if the user explicity requested the function be inlined, rather than the compiler trying to inline it optimistically.
        Parameters:
        function - The function to test whether it can be inlined
        Returns:
        true if the function can be inlined

      • functionBodyHasNonInlineableNodes

        public boolean functionBodyHasNonInlineableNodes(IASNode n,
                                        boolean reportInlineProblems,
                                        String functionName,
                                        AtomicInteger exprCount)
        Check for any constructs we know we can't inline, or if the function is too large
        Parameters:
        n - the node to test
        reportInlineProblems - whether or not to report inline problems
        functionName - the name of the function being inlined
        exprCount - a running count of the expressions in the body
        Returns:
        true if the function contains un-inlineable nodes, false if the function body can be inlined

      • functionBodyHasNonInlineableInstructions

        public boolean functionBodyHasNonInlineableInstructions(InstructionList insns,
                                               boolean reportInlineProblems,
                                               String functionName)
        Iterate through the Instructions which are to be inlined and ensure the can all be inlined. Any Instruction which makes use of the scope chain will cause the inline to fail.
        Parameters:
        insns - inlined instructions
        reportInlineProblems - whether or not to report inline problems
        functionName - the name of the function being inlined
        Returns:
        true if all instructions are OK to be inlined
